subject: Technology
title: Digital Divide: Who Gets Left Behind
description: A short lesson to help you apply Digital Divide: Who Gets Left Behind.

hook.text: Smartphones connect 5 billion people. But 3 billion still have limited or no internet access.

buildup.text: In wealthy nations, smartphones are everywhere. In many developing regions, connectivity is a luxury.

discovery.text: The digital divide means unequal access to education, banking, healthcare, and economic opportunity.

twist.text: Even in rich countries, rural areas and elderly populations face significant connectivity gaps.

climax.text: As more services go digital-only, being offline increasingly means being excluded from society.

punchline.text: The smartphone revolution left billions of people behind.

quiz.question: What is the digital divide?
options: The gap between Apple and Android users
Unequal access to internet and digital technology
